tn.text: John begins to describe a vision about receiving a measuring rod and two witnesses that God appointed. This vision also takes place between the blowing of the sixth and seventh trumpets.

tn.ref: A reed was given to me
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone gave me a reed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: given to me ... I was told
tn.text: The words "me" and "I" refer to John.

tn.ref: and those who worship in it
tn.text: "and count those who worship in the temple"
to treat something as worthless by walking on it
two months** - "42 months" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
God continues speaking to John.

Why they will wear sackcloth can be made explicit. AT: "wearing rough mourning clothes" or "they will wear scratchy clothes to show that they are very sad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]] and (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]]) )
John explains who these witness are.

tn.ref: These witnesses are the two olive trees and the two lampstands
tn.text: "These witnesses are the ones represented by the two olive trees and the two lampstands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])

tn.ref: the two olive trees and the two lampstands
tn.text: John expects his readers to know about them because many years earlier another prophet had written about them. AT: "the two olive trees and the two lampstands that scripture tells about" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]]) )

tn.ref: fire comes out of their mouth and devours their enemies
tn.text: Because this is about future events, it can also be stated in the future tense. AT: "fire will come out of their mouth and devour their enemies"

Fire burning and killing people is spoken of as if it were an animal that could eat them up. AT: "fire ... will destroy their enemies" or "fire ... will completely burn up their enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: to close up the sky so that no rain will fall
tn.text: John speaks of the sky as if it had a door that can be opened to let rain fall or closed to stop the rain. AT: "to keep rain from falling from the sky"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: to strike the earth with every kind of plague
tn.text: John speaks of the plagues as if they were a stick that someone could hit the earth with. AT: "to cause all kinds of trouble to occur on earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

This is an extremely deep narrow hole. Possible meanings are 1) the pit has no bottom; it continues to go down further forever or 2) the pit is so deep that it is as if it had no bottom. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:09:01|9:1]].
This refers to the bodies of the two witnesses.

tn.ref: in the street of the great city
tn.text: The city had more than one street. This was a public place where people could see them. AT: "in one of the streets of the great city" or "in the main street of the great city"
"3 full days and one half day" or "3.5 days" or "3 1/2 days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
They served the Lord, and like him would die in that city.

tn.ref: They will not permit them to be placed in a tomb
tn.text: This was a sign of disrespect.

tn.ref: will rejoice over them and celebrate
tn.text: "will rejoice that the two witnesses have died"

tn.ref: even send gifts to one another
tn.text: This action shows how happy the people were.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

tn.ref: because these two prophets tormented those who lived on the earth
tn.text: This is the reason that the people were so happy that the witnesses had died.
"3 full days and one half day" or "3.5 days" or "3 1/2 days." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:11:08|11:9]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: a breath of life from God will enter them
tn.text: The ability to breathe is spoken of as if it were something that can go into people. AT: "God will cause the two witnesses to breathe again and live" (UBS) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Great fear will fall on those who see them
tn.text: Fear is spoken of as if it is a object that can fall on people. AT: "Those who see them will be extremely afraid"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Possible meanings are 1) the two witnesses will hear or 2) the people will hear what is said to the two witnesses.
The word "voice" refers to the one who speaks. AT: "someone speak loudly to them from heaven and" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"say to the two witnesses"
"7,000 people" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"those who do not die" or "those who are still living"

tn.ref: give glory to the God of heaven
tn.text: "say that the God of heaven is glorious"
"The second terrible event is over." See how you translated "The first woe is past" in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:09:10|9:12]].

tn.ref: The third woe is coming quickly
tn.text: Existing in the future is spoken of as coming. AT: "The third woe will happen soon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The last of the seven angels begins to sound his trumpet.

This is the last of the seven angels. AT: "the final angel" or "angel number seven." See how you translated "seventh" in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:08:01|8.1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: loud voices spoke in heaven and said
tn.text: The phrase "loud voices" represents speakers who spoke loudly. AT: "Speakers in heaven spoke loudly and said"
Here this refers to the authority to rule the world. AT: "The authority to rule the world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to everyone in the world. AT: "everyone in the world"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the kingdom of our Lord and of his Christ
tn.text: The word "kingdom" here refers to the authority that our Lord and his Christ have to rule. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord and of his Christ
tn.text: "Our Lord and his Christ are now the rulers of the world"
four elders** - "24 elders." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:04:04|4:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
They lay down facing the ground. See how you translated a similar expression in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:04:09|4:10]].

tn.ref: Lord God Almighty, the one who is and who was
tn.text: These phrases can be stated as sentences. AT: "You, Lord God, are the ruler over all. You are the one who is, and you are the one who was" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_distinguish]])
"the one who exists" or "the one who lives"
"who has always existed" or "the one who has always lived"

tn.ref: you have taken your great power
tn.text: What God did with his great power can be stated clearly. AT: "you have defeated with your power everyone who has rebelled against you" (UBS) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The twenty-four elders continue praising God.
The words "you" and "your" refer to God.
"were extremely angry"
Existing in the present is spoken of as having come. AT: "You are ready to show your anger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Existing in the present is spoken of as having come. AT: "The time is right" or "Now is the time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]).

tn.ref: the prophets, those who are believers, and those who feared your name
tn.text: This list explains what "your servants" means. These were not three completely different groups of people. The prophets also were believers and feared God's name. AT: "the prophets and the others who are believers and fear your name"

tn.ref: the ark of his covenant was seen within his temple
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I saw the ark of his covenant in his temple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Use your language's way of describing what lightning looks like each time it appears. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:04:04|4:5]].
These are the loud noises that thunder makes. Use your language's way of describing the sound of thunder. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:04:04|4:5]].
